page.title: 12Foxlease House
page.content: Foxlease House is a 400 year old Manor House bought by Sir Philip Jennings-Clark in A.D.1500. Three rooms were added by the Adams Bros. in 1775 and are decorated in magnificent Regency style. When the house became a Girl Guide Training Centre, they named these three rooms Scotland, Hampshire, and London. Scotland was the most ornately decorated, finished in gold leaf, with a large crystal chandelier hanging from the ceiling.The house has a total of 56 rooms including a chapel. Foxlease became a Guide Training Headquarters in 1922. Brownies and Guides each donated 1 penny and the viewing of Princess Mary's wedding presents raised Â£6 000. But this was not enough and the house was eventually given to the Girl Guides Association.
